channel.title: Comments on: Monday Go Meditation: Game 65

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Glad you enjoyed it! I'm looking forward to our next battle as well!
item.content:encoded: Glad you enjoyed it! I’m looking forward to our next battle as well!

item.title: By: Daurak
item.dc:creator: Daurak
item.description: Wonderful game review!!! Glad to have gone over it again. I can remember the moves that got tons of thought into them and the feelings I was having through out this one. Thanks again and hope to battle again soon!
item.content:encoded: Wonderful game review!!! Glad to have gone over it again. I can remember the moves that got tons of thought into them and the feelings I was having through out this one. Thanks again and hope to battle again soon!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: No worries man! Hope that all is well and look forward to our next game!
item.content:encoded: No worries man! Hope that all is well and look forward to our next game!

item.title: By: Daurak
item.dc:creator: Daurak
item.description: Sorry I havent been able to watch this game. Been busy but will hopefully get to it soon. I appreciate you doing the review and the work of putting up games. Thanks!
item.content:encoded: Sorry I havent been able to watch this game. Been busy but will hopefully get to it soon. I appreciate you doing the review and the work of putting up games. Thanks!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: That sounds great! I look forward to our games! Ah, but the beauty of online play is your ability to choose your time settings! Just make sure you don't accept anything lower than whatever time limit you desire. (It sounds like you could use at least 20 min main time if not 30 min).
item.content:encoded:
That sounds great! I look forward to our games!
Ah, but the beauty of online play is your ability to choose your time settings! Just make sure you don’t accept anything lower than whatever time limit you desire. (It sounds like you could use at least 20 min main time if not 30 min).

item.title: By: gekkoe
item.dc:creator: gekkoe
item.description: Perhaps we can help one another get over it some. I'll play you later on KGS if you like. You'll almost certainly beat me, but no worries. I play to learn. BTW, one of the main things that bothers me about online play is that I don't really like fast games. I don't feel that I learn from them. They just reinforce bad habits. So, if you do decide to play me, be warned that I'm no blitz player. ;-)
item.content:encoded:
Perhaps we can help one another get over it some. I’ll play you later on KGS if you like. You’ll almost certainly beat me, but no worries. I play to learn.
BTW, one of the main things that bothers me about online play is that I don’t really like fast games. I don’t feel that I learn from them. They just reinforce bad habits. So, if you do decide to play me, be warned that I’m no blitz player. ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: You are most certainly not alone gekkoe. It's almost like I get a mini-anxiety attack when thinking about playing online; but it is something that we should realize that we are doing to ourselves. Haha. Just one step at a time, hopefully we won't have this problem in the future!
item.content:encoded: You are most certainly not alone gekkoe. It’s almost like I get a mini-anxiety attack when thinking about playing online; but it is something that we should realize that we are doing to ourselves. Haha. Just one step at a time, hopefully we won’t have this problem in the future!

item.title: By: gekkoe
item.dc:creator: gekkoe
item.description: Thanks for talking about your "reservations about playing games". I have a bit of this as well. It's easy enough in person with a real board, or against my computer, but I still find stuff like KGS a little intimidating. Something to get over eh? Nice to hear I'm not alone...
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for talking about your “reservations about playing games”. I have a bit of this as well. It’s easy enough in person with a real board, or against my computer, but I still find stuff like KGS a little intimidating.
Something to get over eh?
Nice to hear I’m not alone…

item.title: By: gekkoe
item.dc:creator: gekkoe
item.description: Yep. I think they're great too. Inspired me to do the same with some of my own games. Seems a useful practice! :)
item.content:encoded: Yep. I think they’re great too. Inspired me to do the same with some of my own games. Seems a useful practice! ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: The decision to start commenting on every move came from my own reading of other blogs and commentaries and felt one too many times that I couldn't understand how the player got from point A to point B. After a while though, I realized that this was also a good exercise for myself as well. So to answer your question, it's both!
item.content:encoded: The decision to start commenting on every move came from my own reading of other blogs and commentaries and felt one too many times that I couldn’t understand how the player got from point A to point B. After a while though, I realized that this was also a good exercise for myself as well. So to answer your question, it’s both!
